intro: Microula, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. These plants are typically small, herbaceous annuals or perennials that thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Microula species are well adapted to harsh conditions, with deep root systems and the ability to store water.
